imdb.title: Hyouka
imdb.plot: Hyouka centers on Oreki Hotarou and his life in the Classic Literature Club. His mundane world is flipped upside down as they begin to solve various mysteries.

episodes.title: The Esteemed Classics Club has been Restored
episodes.plot: A high school boy Houtarou Oreki has no energy, and always wants to be efficient in his life. His sister Tomoe offered him to join the Classic Literature Club that faced the prospect of disbandment due to no members. When he goes to the club room, there is another charming applicant for joining the club.

episodes.title: Activities of the Esteemed Classics Club
episodes.plot: Eru grows bored of the club's lack of activities, and suggests that they prepare an anthology to submit for the school's culture festival in the fall. While tracking down previous anthologies, the club discovers a mystery in the school's library.

episodes.title: Inheritors of the Classics Club and Its Circumstances
episodes.plot: Over coffee, Eru opens up to Oreki to explain why she joined the club, and asks him for his help with a personal matter. Still unable to locate any anthologies, the club members run into an obstacle when trying to search the club's previous room.

episodes.title: Past Days of the Classics Club and Its Glory
episodes.plot: Eru decides to solicit Satoshi and Mayaka's help hypothesizing what happened to her uncle. The club members meet at the Chitanda estate, where they present their research and surmise what they believe happened 45 years ago.

episodes.title: The Truth of the Classics Club and Its Past
episodes.plot: Houtarou is torn between continuing with his "gray" life and the "rosy" life that the others live. A phone call from Houtarou's sister leads him to believe that there are pieces missing to his theory regarding the events of Sekitani's expulsion.

episodes.title: To Commit a Deadly Sin
episodes.plot: Houtarou's history class is interrupted by an outburst coming from Eru's math class, prompting a discussion in the Classic Literature Club about the nature of the seven deadly sins, and what might provoke Eru to become angry.

episodes.title: Seeing the True Identity
episodes.plot: During summer vacation, the Classic Literature Club members take a trip into the mountains to stay at a hot springs resort inn run by Mayaka's relatives. While there, Eru and Mayaka see what appears to be the ghost of a man who hanged himself.

episodes.title: Let's Go to the Screening!
episodes.plot: One of Eru's acquaintances invites the Classic Literature Club to a screening of a student film made by the members of Class 2-F so they can offer their opinions. When the movie takes an unexpected turn, the club is called on to help find a solution.

episodes.title: Murder Case in the Deserted Furuoka
episodes.plot: In search of a conclusion to their movie, the assistant director, the prop master, and the publicist meet with the Classic Literature Club members one at a time to propose their solutions to the unfinished murder mystery.

episodes.title: What No One Noticed
episodes.plot: Irisu asks Houtarou again that he infers the conclusion of their movie Hongo thought from her notes or the scenes which they have already taken.

episodes.title: End Credits of the Fool
episodes.plot: Mayaka, Satoshi and Eru criticize Houtarou for ignoring Hongo's feelings. Why didn't Irie ask Hongo for the story through Eba? --- He just realizes what Irisu really wanted him to do.

episodes.title: Practically Piled to the Ceiling
episodes.plot: It is the first day of the school culture festival, and the club members look forward to it with both longing and dread. They must come up with a way to sell all of the copies of "Hyouka" that were printed, as dauntless as the task seems.

episodes.title: A Corpse by Evening
episodes.plot: Satoshi tries to use the Quiz Club's quiz show event to promote the Classic Literature Club. Eru goes around beating the bushes for ways to help sell all of the copies of "Hyouka." More and more items end up missing from various clubs.

episodes.title: Wildfire
episodes.plot: The Classic Literature Club cooking team competes against three other teams in the Cooking Club's timed "Wild Fire" competition. However, Mayaka is delayed drawing posters for the Manga Club. Will she be able to finish in time to compete?

episodes.title: The Juumonji Incident
episodes.plot: When the members of the Classic Literature Club talk about the happenings in the festival, they find the theft cases are occurred by Jumonji consecutively. From the signature on the cards that the thief left, Houtarou infers that "Jumonji" has the other meaning, not a last name.

episodes.title: The Last Target
episodes.plot: Satoshi is ready for Jumoji to strike, but when the anticipated target is passed over, he must reconsider his strategy. Tomoe gives Houtarou a copy of "A Corpse By Evening," and Eru notices that the art style is similar to one she has seen elsewhere.

episodes.title: Kudryavka's Order
episodes.plot: The members of the Classic Literature Club get a lot of students in the club room to catch the thief. The club magazine "Hyouka No.46" sells like wildfire because of that.

episodes.title: Are the Mountains Sunny?
episodes.plot: A helicopter in the sky reminds Houtarou of the teacher Ogi of his junior high school days. Houtarou has assumed that Ogi likes helicopters because he saw that Ogi had a relieved smile when Ogi found a helicopter through a window during a class. But, Satoshi tells him Ogi wasn't interested in it. Houtarou is curious about why he smiled at that time.

episodes.title: Anyone Who Knows
episodes.plot: Houtarou tells Eru that he can come up with a plausible explanation for any situation she can think of, so when a seemingly mundane schoolwide announcement is made, she challenges him to figure out the reason behind the announcement.

episodes.title: Sappy New Year
episodes.plot: At New Year's, Eru invites Houtarou to join her in paying her family's respects at the town shrine. When Eru agrees to run a quick errand, however, she and Houtarou find themselves in an unexpected and compromising situation.

episodes.title: The Chocolate Files
episodes.plot: Japanese people have a custom that girls confess their own love to the boys with a chocolate on Valentine's Day. Mayaka has prepared a chocolate for Satoshi with the help of Eru, but it was stolen from the club room on the day.

episodes.title: Doll in the Distance
episodes.plot: Houtarou is enlisted by Eru to appear in a Dolls' Festival parade that her local shrine holds every year. When construction work unexpectedly causes a last-minute detour, it leaves the participants wondering what went awry.

episodes.title: What Should Be Had
episodes.plot: Houtarou's sister returns home and sets her lethargic brother up with a temporary job filling in as a lifeguard at the city pool. Satoshi invites Eru and Mayaka out to see Houtarou at work and the group stumble upon a minor mystery to be solved.
